natural problem: If $x$ is a real number, find $49x^2+14x(19-7x)+(19-7x)^2$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(49 * x powr 2) + (14 * x * (19 - (7 * x))) + ((19 - (7 * x)) powr 2) = 361"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $x$ is a real number, find $49x^2+14x(19-7x)+(19-7x)^2$. The final Answer is 361
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} &49x^2+14x(19-7x)+(19-7x)^2\\ &\qquad=(7x)^2+2(7x)(19-7x)+(19-7x)^2\\ &\qquad=[7x+(19-7x)]^2\\ &\qquad=19^2\\ &\qquad=\boxed{361}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(49 * x powr 2) + (14 * x * (19 - (7 * x))) + ((19 - (7 * x)) powr 2) = 361"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
